PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: GIS Developer with a strong foundation in GEO-IT, skilled in making sense of spatial data analysis and bringing it to life through web applications.

My path has been guided by a passion for geographic data and its applications in the digital space. Outside of my profession, I love
, and I am an energetic competitor in Geoguessr.

I specialize in GIS tools like QGIS and ArcGIS Pro, and I enjoy using my knowledge to develop innovative web-GIS solutions. I consider myself a perpetual learner, always looking to improve and expand my skills.

EXPERIENCES.DESCRIPTION: Recently started as a Geospatial developer.

I played a key role in a project focused on enhancing WebGIS applications. My main contributions were to the development and maintenance of a modular frontend GIS viewer and the creation of a configuration page for easy client customization. This effort was part of a four-person team dedicated to innovating GIS tools, requiring expertise in web development, GIS, Agile methodologies, and technologies like GeoServer and PostGIS.

I participated in a wide range of geo-information and geo-ICT projects. The position required a versatile skill set, including data analysis, mapping, process automation, spatial database management, and supporting the development team with various programming tasks.

During my internship as a Web-GIS Developer, I was part of a small development team of 4. My main project focused on spatio-temporal data visualization in a Web-GIS application. The organization identified a need for a tool to represent the temporal dimension of geo-data, given its relevance in multi-temporal spatial datasets.

My master thesis titled "Slums and Urban Land Consumption in Brazilian Metropolitan Areas: Monitoring SDG Indicators 11.1.1 and 11.3.1 Using Open Data" addresses the critical issues of fast and uncontrolled urban expansion, slum formation, and their environmental and social impacts in Brazil. The study focuses on SÃ£o Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, and Belo Horizonte, Brazil's most populated metropolitan areas known for their extensive slums.

Esri Nederland and the Dutch Kadaster identified a critical inclusivity problem in current basemaps, noting their inadequacy for colorblind users due to problematic color combinations. This led to a consultancy project focused on optimizing basemaps for individuals with color vision impairments, starting with the key question: How can basemap accessibility for colorblind people be improved?

This role was situated within an academic context, offering support across various geographical and spatial research projects. Our work catered to both internal clients, such as professors from different university departments, and external stakeholders. 
 Working part-time at 20 hours per week, I managed to balance this role with my academic studies, bridging the gap between academic research and real-world GIS applications.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Spatio-Temporal Data Visualization in a Web-GIS App
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: A Web-GIS application that visualizes spatio-temporal data, focusing on the temporal dimension of geo-data. The application was developed to address the need for a tool to represent the temporal dimension of geo-data in multi-temporal spatial datasets.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Slums and Urban Land Consumption in Brazilian Metropolitan Areas
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: A study that monitors SDG indicators 11.1.1 and 11.3.1 using open data to address the critical issues of fast and uncontrolled urban expansion, slum formation, and their environmental and social impacts in Brazilian metropolitan areas.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Tailoring basemaps for color vision impaired people
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: A consultancy group project focused on optimizing basemaps for individuals with color vision impairments. The project aimed to improve basemap accessibility for colorblind people by identifying problematic color combinations and proposing alternative solutions.
